5640/A0/04/401/012.headline: Two studies to support the Ministry of Labour  Social Protection and Family are underway and expected to be finalized in 2017. They will help ensure that decentralization reform is accompanied by equitable financing  and will inform UNICEF's advocacy and technical assistance on child-sensitive cash transfers.
5640/A0/04/401/012.target_value: Resilience component assessed and recommendations provided to the MLSPF to improve the social protection system

5640/A0/04/401/012.status_value: Gaps in the understanding were filled through research of human resources and training needs assessment of social work in Moldova  which was validated by MLSPF. Meanwhile  an internal mapping of social services was conducted for future use.
5640/A0/04/401/012.indicator_name: Extent to which the gaps in understanding of current social services and social work are addressed  with particular focus on vulnerable children and their families
5640/A0/04/401/012.headline: Two studies to support the Ministry of Labour  Social Protection and Family are underway and expected to be finalized in 2017. They will help ensure that decentralization reform is accompanied by equitable financing  and will inform UNICEF's advocacy and technical assistance on child-sensitive cash transfers.
5640/A0/04/401/012.target_value: Gaps are partially analysed in terms of the existing social protection provisions.

5640/A0/04/401/006.status_value: Actions focusing on desegregation of Roma classes ongoing in all three target communities.  In one community in the North of the country new methods are introduced in school to desegregate Roma classes. In one community in the centre a number of children from Roma segregated school attend the school in the neighboring village. In the third school from the centre children form gymnasium level were transferred to the mixed school in the neighboring village.
5640/A0/04/401/006.indicator_name: The number of communities that have Roma segregated schools or classes

5640/A0/04/401/002.status_value: 18 districts. During the academic year 2014-2015  the educational system has identified 13 230 cases of abuse or violence against children in all districts  as follows: physical violence (6 383)  psychological abuse (3 559)  children's neglect (3 202)  labor exploitation (362)  sexual abuse (47)  and trafficking in persons (3 cases). According to the Annual Social report for 2014  a total of 80 victims of THB (57 women and 23 men  including 5 children) were identified through the National Referr

5640/A0/04/401/002.status_value: While the nationwide diversion rate in cases involving children offenders is 45%  data from the Ministry of Interior demonstrate that during the 8 months of 2015  only 28% (56 out of 198 cases) were diverted at the criminal investigation stage in 5 selected districts.
